turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kreimbach-Kaulbach.
turn.1: What can you tell me about the 2009 election?
turn.2: The municipal election held on 7 June 2009 yielded the following results: The “WGs” are voters’ groups.
turn.4: Kreimbach-Kaulbach’s mayor is Wolfgang Caspers, and his deputies are Karl Barthel, Martina Heil and Werner Gillmann.
turn.5: What is the coat of arms of Kreimbach-Kaulbach?
turn.6: The German blazon reads: The municipality’s arms might in English heraldic language be described thus: Per fess argent dexter issuant from the line of partition a mount of three Or issuant from which a Roman watchtower masoned sable and roofed of the field with a deck of the second, sinister issuant from the line of partition a wolf rampant gules, and party per fess wavy gules three roundels of the first in fess and argent two crows displayed, beaks to chief, of the third.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Given Kreimbach-Kaulbach’s history of being two separate villages then thrust together, it is no surprise that it has a complicated heraldic history.
turn.10: Before the 1969 merger, Kreimbach bore arms with the Roman watchtower as the main charge, but it stood on a flat-topped green hill and had a wooden palisade around it in natural colour (“proper” in heraldry).
turn.11: What was the difference between the two?
turn.12: The deck was also wooden in colour instead of gold.
